definition: members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: Later Jin Dynasty was also once abolished Hanlin degree, their functions and to go in the book rounding.
sentences.chinese: 后晋还一度废除翰林学士，其职并归中书舍人。

sentences.english: The Han wood's bachelor's degree was a vice minister class, was a Qing further mutually.
sentences.chinese: 翰林学士就是副部长级了，进一步就是卿相。

sentences.english: HAN-Lin played a major political role in the late Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 唐代自进入中后期，翰林学士的政治角色日形重要。

definition: Imperial Hanlin Academy, lasting from Tang dynasty until 1911
refers to academics employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards, forming the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院
imperial censor (formal title of a dynastic official)
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
Minister of Revenue (from the Han dynasty onwards)
honorific title during Tang to Qing times, approx. "Glorious grand master"
same as 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1] Book of History
title of the temporary position in the Hanlin Academy, conferred to meritorious candidates until the next examination
